dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 2621 IH: Honoring Vocational Education Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Scholten (for herself, Mr. Molinaro, Mr. Moskowitz, and Ms. Crockett) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Accountability

form.official-title: To require the Bureau of the Census to add a new educational attainment category to the Current Population Survey.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Honoring Vocational Education Act.

section.header: Current Population Survey vocational education recognition

subsection.text: Beginning not later than one year after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Director of the Bureau of the Census shall ensure that, to the extent practicable, the Current Population Survey provides for a separate category of educational attainment for Postsecondary Nondegree Awardees.

subparagraph.text: The term Postsecondary Nondegree Awardee means an individual who—

subclause.text: a regular high school diploma (as such term is defined in section 8101 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 7801)) or its recognized equivalent; and

clause.text: has not received an associates, bachelor’s, masters, graduate, or professional degree.

subparagraph.text: An individual who meets the criteria in subparagraph (A) is a Postsecondary Nondegree Awardee regardless of whether such individual attended an institution of higher education (as defined in section 102(a) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1002(a))).

paragraph.text: The term recognized postsecondary credential has the meaning given such term in section 3 of the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (29 U.S.C. 3102), except that such term does not include an associate or baccalaureate degree.
The term State means each of the several States, the District of Columbia, and the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico.
